class.name: EcscfOfflineChargingProfileClass
class.description: This is Managed Object Class for E-CSCF Offline Charging Profile

attribute.name: ecscfOfflineChargingProfile
attribute.description: The name of the Profile.

attribute.name: ecscfChargingPreferredCallingPartyAddress
attribute.description: Configure what information is preferred in Calling-Party-Address, SIP URI and/or TEL-URI. What is available is used, if the preferred does not exist. Valid values: noPrefer, preferSIP, preferTEL, both.

attribute.name: ecscfChargingDefaultDestinationRealm
attribute.description: Defines the default destination realm.

attribute.name: ecscfChargingEnabledCancel
attribute.description: This attribute determines if the CSCF generates a charging event related to a CANCEL message.

attribute.name: ecscfChargingEnabledNon2xx
attribute.description: Note: This parameter is deprecated. Use EcscfOfflineChargingEnabled3xx and EcscfOfflineChargingEnabled4xx5xx6xx instead. This attribute determines if the CSCF generates a charging event related for a non 2XX final response for an INVITE message.

attribute.name: ecscfOfflineChargingEnabled3xx
attribute.description: This attribute determines if the E-CSCF generates a charging event for a 3XX final response (except 3xx received from LRF via SIP Ml Interface, in such case, no matter what value this parameter is set, there is no charging event generated by E-CSCF).

attribute.name: ecscfOfflineChargingEnabled4xx5xx6xx
attribute.description: This attribute determines if the E-CSCF generates a charging event for a 4XX, 5XX and 6XX final response (except 4xx, 5xx or 6xx received from LRF via SIP Ml Interface, in such case, no matter what value this parameter is set, there is no charging event generated by E-CSCF).

class.name: CscfMediaContainer
class.description: This is Managed Object Class for CSCF Media Container

class.name: CscfMediaAuthorizationPolicyContainer
class.description: This is Managed Object Class for CSCF Media Authorization Policy Container

attribute.name: cscfMediaBearerAuthorizationPolicy
attribute.description: Enables the P-CSCF to either activate or inactivate the Media Authorization, the Bearer authorization, the private address handling.

attribute.name: cscfUseBearerAuthIncludeApplicationId
attribute.description: This parameter specifies whether the CSCF includes or does not include the Application Identifier, if present, from the SIP signaling Accept-Contact header.

attribute.name: cscfEarlyMediaGatingPolicy
attribute.description: This attribute specifies the gating policy when AAR is sent prior to reception of 200 OK for the initial INVITE.

attribute.name: cscfMediaOnHoldBehavior
attribute.description: Determines the behavior upon media on hold. The configuration option applies equally for originating and terminating P-CSCF and is applicable only when P-CSCF is configured to perform bearer authorization.

attribute.name: cscfMaxUpLinkBandwidth
attribute.description: CscfMaxUpLinkBandwidth is used to configure the maximum allowed uplink bandwidth on the SDP answer as part of a media authorization policy.

attribute.name: cscfMaxDownLinkBandwidth
attribute.description: CscfMaxDownLinkBandwidth is used to configure the maximum allowed downlink bandwidth on the SDP answer as part of a media authorization policy.

attribute.name: pcscfRxSipSessionContinueEnabled
attribute.description: This attribute enables the P-CSCF to continue a SIP session regardless if there is an Rx session failure. This attribute is only applicable if the attribute CscfMediaBearerAuthorization is configured either to the value MediaAndBearerAuth or to the value MediaAndBearerAuthXprivaddr.

attribute.name: pcscfRxSipSessionContinueTimer
attribute.description: This attribute specifies the number of milliseconds that the P-CSCF waits for an AAA command after it has sent an AAR command to the PCRF. PcscfRxSipSessionContinueTimer is only applicable if PcscfRxSipSessionContinueEnabled is set to TRUE. At SIP session initiation, if the P-CSCF receives an AAA command before the timer has expired, it stops the timer and proceeds with the SIP session according to the AAA command's result code. For a successful result code, the P-CSCF continues both the SIP session and the Rx session. Otherwise, the P-CSCF continues the SIP session without an Rx session. At SIP session initiation, if the timer expires before the P-CSCF has received an AAA command from the PCRF, the P-CSCF continues the SIP session without an Rx session. At SIP session modification, the P-CSCF continues both the SIP session and the Rx session (provided that an Rx session has been established successfully during session initiation), regardless of the timer expiry or the AAA command's result code. If the timer is set to 0, the P-CSCF does not send an AAR command to the PCRF, and continues the SIP session without initiating or modifying an Rx session. Recommendation: For the timer to be effective, the timer value should be set to a lower value (in seconds) than the Diameter timeout specified by the Diameter attributes maxRequestPendingTime and maxNumberOfRetries.
attribute.dependencies: PcscfRxSipSessionContinueEnabled must be set to TRUE.

attribute.name: cscfRxOrigRealmAddress
attribute.description: Realm address of the P-CSCF.

attribute.name: cscfRxOrigHostAddress
attribute.description: Host address of the P-CSCF.

attribute.name: cscfRxDestRealmAddress
attribute.description: Realm address of the external the PCRF.

attribute.name: cscfRxDestHostAddress
attribute.description: Host address of the Policy and Charging Rules Function (PCRF).

attribute.name: cscfPayloadBlackWhiteListName
attribute.description: Identity of the payload black and white list for P-CSCF Media Authorization.

attribute.name: cscfMediaCodecAnalysisAccordingToBlackListLogic
attribute.description: When set to True, the black list is activated and when set to False, the white list is activated. Payload types configured in a black list are not allowed and will be rejected. Payload types configured in a white list are the only allowed once. All other payload types will be rejected.

attribute.name: cscfMaxMediaFlowTableName
attribute.description: Identity of the max flow per media type table for P-CSCF Media Authorization.
attribute.dependencies: The Managed Object Instance for the CscfMaxMediaFlowTable needs to be created before the cscfMaxMediaFlowTableName is created.

class.name: CscfMediaCodecDataTableContainer
class.description: This is Managed Object Class for CSCF Media Codec Data Table Container

attribute.name: cscfMediaCodecDataEntry
attribute.description: The managed object that defines Max Flow per Media Type, which has the policy name as key.

attribute.name: cscfMediaCodecFrameSize
attribute.description: CscfMediaFrameSize is used to configure the frame size. It is dependent on the payload type.

attribute.name: cscfMediaFrameDuration
attribute.description: CscfMediaFrameDuration is used to configure the frame duration.

attribute.name: cscfMediaCodecDefaultFramesPerPacket
attribute.description:
The number of frames per packet, and is set to one of the following:

  • Configured default number of frames per packet, if ptime is not negotiated in the SDP.

  • Value of ptime divided by the framed duration, if ptime is negotiated to the SDP.

attribute.name: cscfMediaPacketOverhead
attribute.description: CscfMediaPacketOverhead is used to configure the packet overhead, for example IP, UDP, or RTP.

class.name: CscfPayloadBlackWhiteListClass
class.description: This is Managed Object Class for CSCF Payload Black White List

attribute.name: cscfPayloadBlackWhiteList
attribute.description: MediaType is the media type specified for the media component and PayloadType is the RTP payload type. Formet = MediaType:PayloadType

attribute.name: cscfPayloadBlackWhiteEntry
attribute.description: A multi-value attribute containing of payload types that are allowed, that is, white list logic. Note: The entered value is not checked and any value is valid.
